iati-activity.title: PRT - UN Global Vulnerability Alert
iati-activity.description: The objective of the GVA is to ensure that in times of global crises, the fate of the poorest and most vulnerable populations is not marginalised in the international community’s response. iati-activity.title: PRT (R) - Support to the GIVAS Through a Rapid Impact and Vulnerability Analysis Fund (RIVAF)
iati-activity.description: The Rapid Impact and Vulnerability Analysis Fund (RIVAF) is intended to support research which will produce robust evidence of the impact of the global crisis on the poor and vulnerable in developing countries. It is designed to support the Global Impact and Vulnerability Alert System (GIVAS), established by the Secretary-General of the UN to collate and disseminate information on the social impact of global crises, including the present economic downturn. UN agencies (including the World Bank and IMF) are invited to apply to RIVAF for financing to develop reporting systems which improve real-time monitoring and analysis of the crisis

iati-activity.title: Initial Design of the Climate Public Private Partnership (CP3)
iati-activity.description: CP3 aims to demonstrate that climate friendly investments in developing countries, including in renewable energy, water, energy efficiency and forestry are not only ethically right but also commercially viable. It aims to attract new forms of finance such as pension funds and sovereign wealth funds into these areas by creating two commercial private equity funds of funds which will invest in subfunds and projects in developing countries, creating track records of investment performance which should in turn encourage further investments and accelerate the growth of investment in climate.

iati-activity.title: DFID Secondments to the EU (01/04/2011 to/31/03/2015)
iati-activity.description: To enhance the capacity of the European Union in policy analysis and programme management in key areas. These include Maternal and Child Health, Climate Change, Wealth Creation, Water and Sanitation, and issues focussing on Fragile States, Conflict Prevention and Resolution. In addition it will provide support for stronger overall Evaluation and Monitoring of EU spend. The Programme will second approximately 25-30 high calibre DFID staff (Seconded National Experts - SNEs) to the European Commission and related organisations in Brussels and Luxembourg, EU delegations in developing countries, EU Presidencies, and to the new European External Action Service (EEAS) of the European Union. The National Experts on Professional Training scheme (NEPT) will also provide short term oportunities in the EU (Brussels) for staff to get experience and knowledge of how the EU manage their development programmes.

iati-activity.title: CCMCC Promoting cooperation and avoiding conflict in managing the impacts of climate change
iati-activity.description: The aim of this project is to maximise benefits to poor people from international climate change finance. It will do this by generating evidence on the links between climate change and its impacts, and the likelihood of such impacts leading to either conflict or collaboration between and within communiteis. It will help find ways for policies and programmes to foster collaborative rather than conflictual approaches to managing the impacts of climate change at local, national and global levels.

contact-info.mailing-address: Public Enquiry Point, Abercrombie House, Eaglesham Road, East Kilbride, Glasgow G75 8EA

iati-activity.related-activity: Generating the evidence on the potential for climate change policy to be an incentive for collaboration rather than a driver of conflict.
